title: Linear, continuous, bounded, Hermitian, unitary operators and norms

blocks.name: df-nmop
blocks.content: Define the norm of a Hilbert space operator. (Contributed by NM, 18-Jan-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: df-cnop
blocks.content: Define the set of continuous operators on Hilbert space. For every "epsilon" ( ` y ` ) there is a "delta" ( ` z ` ) such that... (Contributed by NM, 28-Jan-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-cnop(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(ccop, crab(s0, co(chba, cmap, chba), wral(s1, chba, wral(s2, crp, wrex(s3, crp, wral(s4, chba, wi(wbr(cfv(cno, co(cv(s4), cmv, cv(s1))), clt, cv(s3)), wbr(cfv(cno, co(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s4)), cmv, cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), clt, cv(s2)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-cnop(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ⊢ ContOp = { s0 ∈(~H[↦]~H)| ∀(s1 ∈ ~H, ∀(s2 ∈ ℝ+, ∃(s3 ∈ ℝ+, ∀(s4 ∈ ~H,((normh `(s4[-h]s1))[<]s3 →(normh `((s0 ` s4)[-h](s0 ` s1)))[<]s2)))))}
  ⊣ d(s0, s4)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s4)
  ⊣ d(s2, s4)
  ⊣ d(s3, s4)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
}

blocks.name: df-lnop
blocks.content: Define the set of linear operators on Hilbert space. (See ~ df-hosum for definition of operator.) (Contributed by NM, 18-Jan-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-lnop(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(clo, crab(s0, co(chba, cmap, chba), wral(s1, cc, wral(s2, chba, wral(s3, chba, wceq(cfv(cv(s0), co(co(cv(s1), csm, cv(s2)), cva, cv(s3))), co(co(cv(s1), csm, cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2))), cva, cfv(cv(s0), cv(s3)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}

blocks.name: df-bdop
blocks.content: Define the set of bounded linear Hilbert space operators. (See ~ df-hosum for definition of operator.) (Contributed by NM, 18-Jan-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: df-unop
blocks.content: Define the set of unitary operators on Hilbert space. (Contributed by NM, 18-Jan-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: df-hmop
blocks.content: Define the set of Hermitian operators on Hilbert space. Some books call these "symmetric operators" and others call them "self-adjoint operators", sometimes with slightly different technical meanings. (Contributed by NM, 18-Jan-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
